title: Visual Editor Guide
summary: Comprehensive guide to using the Nostalgi2D visual editor for asset creation and game development.

content.text: The Nostalgi2D visual editor is a web-based tool that lets you create game assets, design meshes, and manage your project without writing code. This guide covers all major features and workflows.
Editor Interface
The editor consists of several key areas:

items: Top Toolbar - Quick access to common tools and actions
Left Sidebar - Asset browser and project navigator
Center Canvas - Main workspace for designing and editing
Right Sidebar - Properties and settings panel
Bottom Panel - Console and output logs

content.alt: Complete editor interface with all panels labeled
content.caption: The Nostalgi2D editor interface

content.text: Asset Management
The asset browser on the left shows all your game assets organized by type:

items: Meshes - Custom 2D shapes and polygons
Sprites - Images and textures
Scenes - Game scenes and level layouts
Scripts - TypeScript game logic files
Audio - Sound effects and music

content.text: Mesh Designer
The mesh designer is the core tool for creating custom 2D shapes:
Creating a New Mesh

items: Click 'New Mesh' in the asset browser
Enter a name for your mesh
The mesh designer canvas opens in the center
Click to add vertices (points) to define your shape
Vertices must be added in counter-clockwise order

content.text: Mesh Designer Tools
The mesh designer provides several tools in the toolbar:

items: Select Tool - Select and move existing vertices
Add Vertex Tool - Click to add new vertices
Delete Tool - Remove vertices
Grid Snap - Snap vertices to grid
Zoom In/Out - Change canvas zoom level
Center View - Reset camera to center of mesh

content.text: üí° Hold Shift while placing vertices to enable grid snapping for precise alignment.
Mesh Properties
Configure mesh properties in the right sidebar:

items: Name - Unique identifier for the mesh
Material ID - Reference to material/texture
Fill Color - Preview color for the mesh
Tags - Custom tags for organization
Export Settings - Format and optimization options

content.text: Scene Editor
The scene editor lets you visually layout your game scenes:

items: Drag meshes from the asset browser onto the canvas
Position, rotate, and scale actors
Configure actor properties and components
Set up spawn points and boundaries
Test the scene in play mode

Component Inspector
When an actor is selected, the component inspector shows all attached components:

items: Transform - Position, rotation, scale
Sprite - Visual appearance settings
Physics - Mass, velocity, forces
Collider - Collision shape and properties
Custom Components - Your game-specific components

content.text: Add new components using the '+' button at the bottom of the inspector.
Keyboard Shortcuts
Speed up your workflow with these shortcuts:

items: Ctrl+N - New mesh
Ctrl+S - Save current asset
Ctrl+Z - Undo last action
Ctrl+Y - Redo action
Delete - Delete selected vertex/actor
Space - Pan canvas
Scroll - Zoom in/out
F - Frame selected object
Shift+Click - Snap to grid

content.text: Export and Integration
Export your assets for use in game code:
Exporting Meshes

content.code:
# In the editor, click Export on a mesh
# Choose format: JSON (default), PNG, SVG
# Save to your project's assets folder

content.text: Using Exported Assets
Plugin System
The editor can be extended with plugins to add custom functionality:

items: Custom panels for specialized workflows
Additional tools in the mesh designer
Asset importers and exporters
Integration with external tools
Automation scripts

content.text: See the Editor Plugins tutorial for detailed instructions on creating plugins.
Settings and Preferences
Customize the editor to your preferences:

items: Theme - Dark or light color scheme
Grid Size - Spacing for grid snapping
Auto-save - Automatically save work every N minutes
Keybindings - Customize keyboard shortcuts
Canvas - Background color and grid visibility

content.text: Access settings via the gear icon in the top-right corner.
Troubleshooting
Common issues and solutions:

items: Mesh not visible - Check vertex winding order (must be counter-clockwise)
Can't select vertex - Zoom in for better precision
Editor is slow - Close unused panels, reduce canvas quality
Assets not loading - Check browser console for errors
Changes not saving - Check browser storage quota

content.text: Tips and Best Practices

items: Save your work frequently (Ctrl+S)
Use descriptive names for all assets
Organize assets with tags and folders
Keep meshes simple (3-8 vertices)
Test meshes in-game early and often
Use grid snap for precision
Export backups of important assets
